title: Definitions
context: [ยง305J-2] Definitions. Whenever used in this chapter, unless the context otherwise requires: &ldquo;Accredited&rdquo; means holding an institutional accreditation by name to offer post-secondary education as a United States-based institution from a regional or national accrediting agency recognized by the United States Department of Education. &ldquo;Alternative enrollment&rdquo; means the opportunity for a student enrolled in a private college or university that ceases operation to meet the student&rsquo;s educational objectives through education provided by another authorized private college or university, the University of Hawaii system, an area vocational school, or any other educational arrangement acceptable to the director. &ldquo;Authorization&rdquo; means the authorization granted to a private college or university, seminary, or religious training institution as provided in this chapter and any applicable rules and policies. Authorization is not an endorsement by the department. &ldquo;Degree&rdquo; means a statement, diploma, certificate, or other writing in any language that indicates or represents, or is intended to indicate or represent, that the person named thereon is learned in or has satisfactorily completed a prescribed course of study in a particular field of endeavor or that the person named thereon has demonstrated proficiency in a field of endeavor as a result of formal preparation or training. &ldquo;Department&rdquo; means the department of commerce and consumer affairs. &ldquo;Director&rdquo; means the director of commerce and consumer affairs. &ldquo;Enrollment agreement&rdquo; means the contract prepared by a private college or university, seminary, or religious training institution that a student signs to indicate agreement to the terms of admission, delivery of instruction, and monetary terms as outlined in the private college, university, seminary, or religious training institution&rsquo;s student handbook or catalog. &ldquo;Governing board&rdquo; means the elected or appointed group of persons that oversees and controls a private college or university, seminary, or religious training institution. &ldquo;Home state&rdquo; means the state in which the institution holds its principal accreditation. &ldquo;Honorary degree&rdquo; means a statement, diploma, certificate, or other writing in any language that indicates or represents, or that is intended to indicate or represent, that the person named thereon is learned in a field of public service or has performed outstanding public service or that the person named thereon has demonstrated proficiency in a field of endeavor without having completed formal courses of instruction or study or formal preparation or training. &ldquo;Out-of-state public institution&rdquo; means an institution of higher education that is established by a government entity in a state other than Hawaii. &ldquo;Owner&rdquo; means: (1) An individual, if a private for-profit college or university is structured as a sole proprietorship; (2) Partners, if a private for-profit college or university is structured as a partnership; (3) Members in a limited liability company, if a private for-profit college or university is structured as a limited liability company; and (4) Shareholders in a corporation that hold a controlling interest, if a private for-profit college or university is structured as a corporation. &ldquo;Physical presence&rdquo; means: (1) Having a physical location in the State, where students receive synchronous or asynchronous instruction; or (2) Establishing an administrative office in the State in order to: (A) Provide information to prospective students, enrolling students, or the general public about the institution; (B) Provide services to enrolled students; &copy; Provide office space for instructional or non-instructional staff; and (D) Maintain an institutional mailing address, street address, or telephone number in the State. &ldquo;Private college or university&rdquo; means a nonpublic post-secondary education institution having a physical presence in the State that offers associate, baccalaureate, post-baccalaureate, master&rsquo;s, or doctoral degrees or diplomas. For purposes of the requirements of this chapter, an out-of-state public institution shall be considered as a private college or university. &ldquo;Seminary&rdquo; or &ldquo;religious training institution&rdquo; means a bona fide religious post-secondary educational institution that has a physical presence in the State, that is exempt from property taxation under the laws of the State, and that offers associate, baccalaureate, post-baccalaureate, master&rsquo;s, or doctoral degrees or diplomas. &ldquo;Unaccredited post-secondary educational institution&rdquo; means a degree-granting institution that is not accredited or a candidate for accreditation by at least one accrediting agency recognized by the United States Department of Education. &ldquo;University of Hawaii system&rdquo; means the post-secondary educational institution, including all campuses and community colleges, established and existing pursuant to article X, section 5, of the Hawaii State Constitution and chapter 304A.
